00035 BOOST_XINT_INLINE raw_digits_t::raw_digits_t(size_t max_len, bool ro):
00036     copy_count(0), max_length(max_len), readonly(ro) { }

00038 BOOST_XINT_INLINE raw_digits_t::raw_digits_t(size_t max_len, bool ro, digit_t
00039     init): copy_count(0), max_length(max_len), readonly(ro)
00040 {
00041     digits[0] = init;

00044 BOOST_XINT_INLINE size_t raw_digits_t::copy(const raw_digits_t& c, size_t
00045     length)
00046 {
00047     size_t max = (std::min)(max_length, c.max_length);
00048     if (length == 0 || length > max) length = max;
00049     copy(c.digits, length);
00050     return length;
00051 }
00052 
00053 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void raw_digits_t::copy(const digit_t *s, size_t length) {
00054     digit_t *t = digits, *te = t + (std::min)(length, max_length);
00055     while (t != te) *t++ = *s++;
00056 }
00057 
00058 BOOST_XINT_INLINE size_t raw_digits_t::zero(size_t length) {
00059     if (length == 0) length = max_length;
00060     else length = (std::min)(length, max_length);
00061     digit_t *t = digits, *te = t + length;
00062     while (t != te) *t++ = 0;
00063     return length;
00064 }
00065 
00066 BOOST_XINT_INLINE size_t raw_digits_t::copies() const {
00067     return copy_count;
00068 }

00071 // base_digitmanager_t

00073 BOOST_XINT_INLINE raw_digits_t *base_digitmanager_t::alloc(size_t
00074     requested_length, bool readonly) const
00075 {
00076     size_t fixed_digit_length = fixed_length();
00077     size_t len = (fixed_digit_length ? fixed_digit_length :
00078         (std::max)(requested_length, minimum_digits));
00079     size_t count = len - minimum_digits + datasize;
00080 
00081     digit_t *storage = 0;
00082     try {
00083         storage = raw_allocate(count);
00084         if (readonly) return new(storage) raw_digits_t(len, readonly, 0);
00085         else return new(storage) raw_digits_t(len, readonly);
00086     } catch (std::bad_alloc&) {
00087         if (storage) raw_deallocate(storage, len); // Just in case.
00088         throw exceptions::overflow_error("Out of memory allocating integer");
00089     } catch (std::exception&) {
00090         // To make it exception-safe, we've got to ensure that the allocated
00091         // data is properly disposed of if there's an exception, before passing
00092         // the exception on.
00093         if (storage) raw_deallocate(storage, len);
00094         throw;
00095     }
00096 }
00097 
00099 BOOST_XINT_INLINE raw_digits_t *base_digitmanager_t::realloc(raw_digits_t
00100     *data, size_t requested_length) const
00101 {
00102     if (fixed_length() == 0) {
00103         if (data && data->copies() <= 1 && !data->readonly) {
00104             digit_t *rawdata = raw_reallocate(reinterpret_cast<digit_t*>(data),
00105                 requested_length);
00106             if (rawdata != 0) {
00107                 if (reinterpret_cast<digit_t*>(data) == rawdata) {
00108                     *(const_cast<size_t*>(&data->max_length)) = requested_length;
00109                     return data;
00110                 } else {
00111                     raw_digits_t *newdata =
00112                         new(rawdata) raw_digits_t(requested_length, false);
00113                     newdata->copy(*data);
00114                     return newdata;
00115                 }
00116             }
00117         }
00118     } else requested_length = fixed_length();
00119 
00120     // Can't reallocate, move to plan B.
00121     raw_digits_t *r = data;
00122     if (data == 0 || data->copies() > 1 || data->readonly ||
00123         data->max_length < requested_length)
00124     {
00125         r = alloc(requested_length);
00126         if (data) r->copy(*data, requested_length);
00127     }
00128 
00129     return r;
00130 }
00131 
00132 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void base_digitmanager_t::dealloc(raw_digits_t *data) const {
00133     if (data == 0) return;
00134 
00135     size_t len = (data->max_length + datasize - minimum_digits);
00136 
00137     // Since the data was initialized with placement-new, we have to manually
00138     // call the destructor.
00139     data-> ~raw_digits_t();
00140 
00141     // Finally, dispose of it.
00142     raw_deallocate(reinterpret_cast<digit_t*>(data), len);
00143 }
00144 
00148 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void base_digitmanager_t::resize_and_uniquify(size_t
00149     new_requested_max_length)
00150 {
00151     // If the length can't change, and it's already unique, we don't need to do
00152     // anything.
00153     if (fixed_length() > 0 && raw_data->copies() <= 1) return;
00154 
00155     if (new_requested_max_length == 0)
00156         new_requested_max_length = raw_data->max_length;
00157     reset(realloc(raw_data, new_requested_max_length));
00158 }

00162 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void swap(base_digitmanager_t& p1, base_digitmanager_t& p2) {
00163     using std::swap;
00164     swap(p1.raw_data, p2.raw_data);
00165 }

00199 BOOST_XINT_INLINE const base_digitmanager_t *data_t::holder() const {
00200     if (is_nan()) throw exceptions::not_a_number();
00201     return dataholder;

00205 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void data_t::set(int n) {
00206     beginmod(1);
00207     make_unique();
00208     if (n < 0) { negative = true; n = -n; } else negative = false;
00209     assert(n == int(digit_t(n)));
00210     length = 1;
00211     digits()[0] = digit_t(n);
00212     endmod();
00213 }
00214 
00215 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void data_t::set_signed(boost::intmax_t n) {
00216     if (n >= 0) {
00217         set_unsigned(n);
00218     } else if (n == (std::numeric_limits<boost::intmax_t>::min)()) {
00219         // Have to treat the minimum number carefully, because -n is not
00220         // what you'd think it is.
00221         set_unsigned(-(n + 1), true);
00222         --*this;
00223     } else {
00224         set_unsigned(-n, true);
00225     }
00226 }
00227 
00228 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void data_t::set_unsigned(boost::uintmax_t n, bool neg) {
00229     beginmod(detail::digits_in_uintmax);
00230     if (digit_t(n) == n) {
00231         length = 1;
00232         digits()[0] = digit_t(n);
00233     } else {
00234         digit_t *i = digits(), *ie = i + max_length();
00235         while (n != 0 && i != ie) {
00236             *i++ = digit_t(n & digit_mask);
00237             n >>= bits_per_digit;
00238         }
00239         length = (i - digits());
00240     }
00241     negative = neg;
00242     endmod();
00243 }

00246 BOOST_XINT_INLINE data_t data_t::duplicate() const {
00247     data_t r(*this);
00248     r.make_unique();
00249     return r;
00250 }
00251 
00253 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void data_t::duplicate_data(const data_t copy) {
00254     beginmod(copy.length);
00255     digits(); // To trigger any changes from the beginmod call
00256     length = (std::min)(max_length(), copy.length);
00257     negative = copy.negative;
00258     dataholder->copy(copy.dataholder, length);
00259     endmod();
00260 }
00261 
00263 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void data_t::reset(data_t p) {
00264     dataholder->reset(p.dataholder->get());
00265     length = p.length;
00266     negative = p.negative;
00267     call_endmod_hook = true;
00268 }
00269 
00270 BOOST_XINT_INLINE data_t& data_t::operator=(const data_t& p) {
00271     reset(p);
00272     return *this;
00273 }

00275 BOOST_XINT_INLINE const data_t data_t::abs() const {
00276     return data_t(*this, false);

00279 BOOST_XINT_INLINE const data_t data_t::negate() const {
00280     return data_t(*this, !negative);

00283 BOOST_XINT_INLINE bool data_t::same_storage(const data_t n) const {
00284     return (dataholder->get() == n.dataholder->get());
00285 }

00287 BOOST_XINT_INLINE bool data_t::is_unique() const {
00288     return ((*dataholder)->copies() <= 1);
00289 }
00290 
00291 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void data_t::make_unique() {
00292     if (!is_unique()) dataholder->resize_and_uniquify(max_length());
00293 }
00294 
00296 BOOST_XINT_INLINE digit_t data_t::get_digit(size_t i) const {
00297     return (i < length ? (*dataholder)->digits[i] : 0);
00298 }

00300 BOOST_XINT_INLINE digit_t data_t::operator[](size_t i) {
00301     return (*dataholder)->digits[i];
00302 }
00303 
00304 BOOST_XINT_INLINE digit_t *data_t::digits() {
00305     assert(modcount > 0);
00306 
00307     if (mod_requested_size > max_length()) {
00308         dataholder->resize_and_uniquify(mod_requested_size);
00309     } else {
00310         make_unique();
00311     }
00312 
00313     if (mod_requested_extend) {
00314         mod_requested_extend = false;
00315         extend(mod_requested_size, true);
00316     }
00317     mod_requested_size = 0;
00318 
00319     call_endmod_hook = true;
00320     return digits(true);
00321 }
00322 
00323 BOOST_XINT_INLINE const digit_t *data_t::digits() const {
00324     data_t& t(*const_cast<data_t*>(this));
00325     return t.digits(true);
00326 }

00328 BOOST_XINT_INLINE size_t data_t::max_length() const {
00329     return (*dataholder)->max_length;
00330 }
00331 
00332 BOOST_XINT_INLINE bool data_t::is_zero() const {
00333     return (length == 1 && (*this)[0] == 0);
00334 }
00335 
00338 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void data_t::extend(size_t new_length, bool skip_mod) {
00339     if (new_length == 0) new_length = max_length();
00340     else new_length = (std::min)(new_length, max_length());
00341 
00342     if (length < new_length) {
00343         digit_t *d;
00344         if (!skip_mod) {
00345             beginmod();
00346             d = (*dataholder)->digits;
00347         } else d = digits();
00348         digit_t *p = d + length, *pe = d + new_length;
00349         while (p < pe) *p++ = 0;
00350         length = new_length;
00351         if (!skip_mod) endmod();
00352     }
00353 }
00354 
00355 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void data_t::beginmod(size_t requested, bool extend) {
00356     if (modcount++ == 0) {
00357         dataholder->beforemod();
00358         mod_requested_size = requested;
00359         mod_requested_extend = extend;
00360         call_endmod_hook = false;
00361     } else {
00362         mod_requested_size = (std::max)(mod_requested_size, requested);
00363         if (extend) mod_requested_extend = true;
00364     }
00365 }
00366 
00367 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void data_t::endmod(bool allow_negative_zero) {
00368     assert(length <= max_length());
00369 
00370     digit_t *d = digits(true), *p = d + length - 1;
00371     if (call_endmod_hook) {
00372         dataholder->endmod_hook(d);
00373         call_endmod_hook = false;
00374     }
00375 
00376     // Adjust length to skip any leading zeros.
00377     while (p > d && *p == 0) --p;
00378     length = (p - d + 1);
00379 
00380     // Zero isn't negative, unless told otherwise.
00381     if (!allow_negative_zero && p == d && *p == 0) negative = false;
00382 
00383     assert(modcount > 0);
00384     if (--modcount == 0) dataholder->aftermod();
00385 }
00386 
00387 BOOST_XINT_INLINE int data_t::sign(bool allow_signed_zero) const {
00388     if (!allow_signed_zero && is_zero()) return 0;
00389     return (negative ? -1 : 1);
00390 }

00392 BOOST_XINT_INLINE bool data_t::is_odd() const {
00393     return (((*this)[0] & 0x01) != 0);
00394 }
00395 
00396 BOOST_XINT_INLINE bool data_t::is_even() const {
00397     return (((*this)[0] & 0x01) == 0);
00398 }

00400 BOOST_XINT_INLINE size_t data_t::hex_digits() const {
00401     return (log2(*this) + 3) / 4;
00402 }

00407 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void swap(data_t& p1, data_t& p2) {
00408     using std::swap;
00409     swap(p1.length, p2.length);
00410     swap(p1.negative, p2.negative);
00411     swap(*p1.dataholder, *p2.dataholder);
00412 }

00414 BOOST_XINT_INLINE size_t log2_base(boost::uintmax_t n, size_t maxbits) {
00415     size_t lo = 0, hi = maxbits;
00416     while (lo < hi) {
00417         size_t s = lo + ((hi - lo) >> 1);
00418         if (n >= (boost::uintmax_t(1) << s)) lo = s + 1;
00419         else hi = s;
00420     }
00421     return lo;
00422 }
00423 
00427 BOOST_XINT_INLINE data_t abs(const data_t n) {
00428     data_t r(n.abs());
00429     r.beginmod();
00430     r.endmod();
00431     return r;
00432 }
00433 
00434 BOOST_XINT_INLINE size_t log2(const data_t n) {
00435     size_t r = bits_per_digit * (n.length - 1);
00436     return r + log2(n[n.length - 1]);
00437 }
00438 
00439 BOOST_XINT_INLINE size_t log10_bits(size_t bits) {
00440     assert(std::numeric_limits<boost::intmax_t>::digits >= 32);
00441 
00442     digitmanager_t<> holder;
00443     const data_t large_step(holder.new_of_type(), 1000000000);
00444     const data_t small_step(holder.new_of_type(), 10);
00445     const size_t count_per_large_step = 9, count_per_small_step = 1;
00446 
00447     data_t n(new digitmanager_t<>);
00448     pow2(n, bits);
00449     --n;
00450 
00451     size_t r = 0;
00452     while (n >= large_step) { n /= large_step; r += count_per_large_step; }
00453     while (n >= small_step) { n /= small_step; r += count_per_small_step; }
00454     return r;
00455 }
